article.headline: Southern 71, Alcorn State 64
article.story: LORMAN, Miss. (AP) -- Deon Sanders scored 22 points and Timothy Johnson added 19 as Southern came from behind to defeat Alcorn State 71-64 on Saturday night. Southern (10-15, 7-9 Southwestern Athletic Conference), trailing by 12 in the second half, took advantage of several Braves turnovers to take a 61-59 lead with 2:36 to play. Southern then went on an 8-2 run to seal the game. Alcorn State (8-17, 7-9) lost its third straight. The Braves were led by Brian Jackson and Trey Johnson, who each had 17 points. Alcorn State turned the ball over 17 times, resulting in 22 points for the Jaguars, including 14 in the second half. Southern was 28-for-55 from the floor (50.9%).
